subject: Pressing Ahead for You: Quarterly Highlights from WP Engine
preview: Read about our developer experience improvements, our recent SOC 2 Type II examination, and access content from {DE}CODE.                          In this issue:                 We've been hard at wor

full_threads.body:
Read about our developer experience improvements, our recent SOC 2 Type II examination, and access content from {DE}CODE.

In this issue:

We've been hard at work helping to make your development jobs easier. We are also excited to share our successful completion of a SOC 2 Type II examination, content from our first virtual developer conference, other exciting product updates, and key dates to mark on your calendar.

Improving the developer experience.

In February, we launched Local Connect as a new developer feature included in all of our plans! This new feature gives you the power to easily deploy from Local, the #1 local WordPress development tool, to WP Engine with a click of a button. Use Local Connect to further optimize your development workflow.
LEARN MORE ABOUT LOCAL

Another tool included in all plans is the Genesis framework, which lets you easily add custom features to your site and comes with built-in SEO. We are constantly innovating to meet the needs of designers and developers building on WordPress. Genesis 3.3 introduced the ability to download and update Genesis parent theme translations without the need for a separate plugin.
LEARN MORE ABOUT GENESIS

Want to save time and reduce the risk that plugin updates break your site? Smart Plugin Manager has you covered! We've increased the accuracy of our visual regression testing, introduced a weekly update option for more flexibility, added a bulk-edit feature for settings, and delivered support for custom plugins in Git-based repositories. Learn more about Smart Plugin Manager (SPM) or check out the updates today!
GO TO SPM

SOC 2 Type II examination successfully completed.
Last week, we announced that we successfully completed a Service Organization Control (SOC 2®) Type II examination for our customer environment and User Portal. The audit, conducted by Holtzman Partners, found that WP Engine meets the SOC 2 standards for Security and Availability Trust Services Categories.
READ MORE

DE{CODE}: 27 speakers. 12 sessions. 1 event.
In January, WP Engine hosted our first-ever virtual developer conference, DE{CODE}. 1,249 attendees across 57 countries heard the latest insights from leading WordPress developers and community members around the globe. We've now made this content available on-demand! From finding your perfect dev workflow, to headless WordPress, to growing your agency, there's sure to be a topic for you!
WATCH DE{CODE} SESSIONS

Help shape the future of WP Engine. Sign up for our User Research Group!

Platform updates.

User Portal improvements.

We've been focused on improving the WP Engine User Portal experience. So far this year, we launched a new interface with a collapsible left navigation, the ability to quickly search across multiple sites and to sort sites by name, group, storage, bandwidth, or visits, and one-click access from the User Portal to WP Admin.
ACTIVATE SEAMLESS LOGIN

PHP 7.4 is available.

PHP 7.4 is available on our platform! Use the PHP Test Driver and the PHP Selector in your User Portal to prepare and upgrade. Running the latest version of PHP is considered best practice, improves performance, and prevents bad actors from taking advantage of security vulnerabilities in older PHP versions. We've seen up to 10% faster page transaction times after an upgrade to PHP 7.4.
PREPARE AND UPGRADE

Easier SSL uploads.

Ensuring the ongoing security of your WordPress sites is a commitment we take seriously. We've launched several improvements to the 3rd-party SSL management process to make it simpler for you to ensure the same. In February, we launched the ability to self-service upload a 3rd party SSL certificate. In March, we added a direct file upload option.
LEARN MORE

Point of view.

SOMETHING TO WATCH

Retention is the new growth. In this on-demand webinar, Neil Patel, SEO expert and influencer, talks about growing your business by focusing on retention while still working on filling the top of the funnel.

SOMETHING TO READ

The world is changing, and so is your audience. Where your brand fits into their lives has changed along with everything else. Read more about how to adapt your brand in a crisis.

Mark your calendar.

6 May: Keeping your (digital) house in order webinar.

10 June: Summit/2020 is going digital! Register for free.

Thank you for trusting us to power your WordPress sites. We hope to earn your business every day and continue in our mission to help you win online. If you have any questions, please reach out to our 24/7 Technical Support team.

THANK YOU FOR BEING A VALUED CUSTOMER

WP Engine, 504 Lavaca St., Suite 1000, Austin, TX

Manage preferences
